message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
synchronized(collection) {
    Iterator iterator = collection.iterator(); 
    while (iterator.hasNext()) {
        Object object = iterator.next();
        // Do something with object
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Java SE API does not provide a built-in way to programmatically release a lock on a collection. However, you can use the synchronized keyword to ensure that only one thread can access the collection at a time. This code block will lock the collection, iterate over it, and then release the lock when it's done. The lock is released when the synchronized block is exited, not when the wrapper is garbage collected.
